      • getTypeArgument

        public static java.lang.reflect.Type getTypeArgument(java.lang.reflect.Type type,
                                                     java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable<? extends java.lang.Class<?>> typeVariable)
        Gets a single type argument from the set of type arguments of a class/interface based on a declaring class of the supplied typeVariable. For instance, given the parameterised type representing Map&lt;String,Integer&gt; and the typeVariable of Map.class.getTypeParameters()[0], then this method will return String.class. This method will work even if the type represented by type is a subtype of the required type and does not itself have any template arguments. For example, this method will determine that both of the parameters for the interface Map are Object for the subtype Properties even though the subtype does not directly implement the Map interface. If the parameterized type's type arguments are TypeVariables or WildcardType, then these are returned. If the type is not a parameterised type, but a raw Class, and typeVariable is a valid TypeVariable of the type or its super type/interfaces, then the method will return the type representing the type argument. For example, if type is ArrayList.class and typeVariable is List.class.getTypeParameters()[0], then the method will return the equivalent of ArrayList.class.getTypeParameters()[0] This method throws IllegalArgumentException if type is not assignable to toClass. It returns an Object.class if the actual type parameter can not be determined.
        Parameters:
        type - the type from which to determine the type parameters of toClass
        typeVariable - the specific typeVariable of toClass to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the Class of the type argument, or null if type is not assignable to toClass
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not assignable to toClass.

      • getTypeArgument

        @Deprecated
public static <T> java.lang.reflect.Type getTypeArgument(java.lang.reflect.Type type,
                                                                      java.lang.Class<T> toClass,
                                                                      java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable<java.lang.Class<T>> typeVariable)
        Deprecated. use getTypeArgument(java.lang.reflect.Type, java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable)
        Gets a single type argument from the set of type arguments of a class/interface based on a the toClass subtype. For instance, given the parameterised type representing Map&lt;String,Integer&gt; , the toClass value of Map.class, and the typeVariable of Map.class.getTypeParameters()[0], then this method will return String.class. This method will work even if the type represented by type is a subtype of the required type and does not itself have any template arguments. For example, this method will determine that both of the parameters for the interface Map are Object for the subtype Properties even though the subtype does not directly implement the Map interface. If the type is not a parameterised type, but a raw Class then the method will return Object.class

        This method throws IllegalArgumentException if type is not assignable to toClass. It returns an Object.class if the actual type parameter can not be determined.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of toClass
        Parameters:
        type - the type from which to determine the type parameters of toClass
        toClass - the class whose type parameter is to be determined based on the subtype type
        typeVariable - the specific typeVariable of toClass to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the Class of the type argument, or null if type is not assignable to toClass
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if type is not assignable to toClass.

      • abbreviatedName

        Parameters:
        type - the type whose name should be abbreviated.
        Returns:
        the abbreviated class name

      • ensureConsistentType

        public static java.lang.reflect.Type ensureConsistentType(java.lang.reflect.Type type)
        Ensures a consistent implementation of the different sub types i.e. ParameterizedType, Class, TypeVariable and GenericArrayType.

        This is useful if you need to compare them, as implementations from different vendors do not generally compare as equal, even if the type information they convey is equivalent.

        Calling this method with two equivalent types, from two different implementations, will result in two types that will be equal i.e. ensureTypeImpl(t1).equals(ensureTypeImpl(t2)) will return true.

        Parameters:
        type - the type, from any implementation, for which a consistent implementation is required.
        Returns:
        the same type, but from a consistent implementation.
